data.title: double JSON.stringify/parse when talking to extension host process
data.body: the default IPC mechanism in nodejs already does [JSON.stringify](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/master/lib/internal/child_process.js#L586) and [JSON.parse](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/master/lib/internal/child_process.js#L432) before sending and after receiving messages. Maybe we gain a little bit of performance we don't do right before/after.

data.title: Hover should protect itself against huge data

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps:
- TypeScript repository
- Open file checker.ts
- Hover over Diagnostic

Observe: the shown hover is useless since it is clipped and shows the bottom of the info. Profiling also shows that most of the time is spent in tokinzing the hover. In the Diagnostic case the hover is 3876 lines long and all lines get tokenized.

Possible solution:
- the language service makes sure that it hover is reasonable.
- the hover protects itself as well.

I actually think we should do both. The language service should get a hint about the max lines in the hover and should cut the info and the hover should protected itself.

data.title: launch.json preLaunchTask

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I have several issues with it:
1. it appears that it at least partially ignores the configuration of the named task in the `tasks.json`. For example, if I have a task `watch:scss` with `"showOutput": "never"` there - running it manually doesn't invoke new tab with output, but if I also add it to `launch.json` via `"preLaunchTask": "watch:scss"` - it opens output every time I re/launch the app. However it seems that it does respect the `isWatching` flag, since it doesn't start the app until I terminate the task manually if the setting is false/omitted or it does start the app if the setting is set to true.
2. if the task is a persistent one (`"isWatching": true`) relaunching the app prompts me to terminate the already running one. And it doesn't start the app right away if I chose to terminate it in the prompt - I need to run it again. Which is annoying as hell as you can imagine. There should be an additional setting for either silently restarting the `preLaunchTask` or silently skip the task launch and assuming that the already running should run until the end of the current session. And/or there should be a default based on the either - in any case prompting is not an option.
3. `preLaunchTask` is hardly present in the documentation at all. I think many more people would complain if they just knew that this option even exist...

thanks in advance.

data.title: after removing mono-debug from VSCode help users to install from the marketplace
data.body: Since we will remove mode-debug from VSCode soon, we should help existing users to install mono-debug from the marketplace when they try to run a mono session.

data.title: Restore contents of quick open when reopening quick open after closing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When going to a file (⌘-P) or executing a command (F1/SHIFT-⌘-P) as well as when interacting with other top-window dialogues (SHIFT-⌘-O) it would be really nice to keep the dialogue open (or at least pre-filled with whatever was written into it when tabbing-out and back -in the application.

This is useful when looking up a command online (having to tab-out of vscode and looking into a browser/mail) or also when working with other files (e.g., on a multi-file LaTeX document you start opening a file to edit, forget which is the correct one and quickly check it from the open PDF, when you get back you have to re-type it all in).

Overall it would be nice to have this feature (also potentially behind a setting).

data.title: Rename widget isn't focused when out of view
data.body:
1. Put cursor on a _renameable_ token.
2. Scroll until the token is out of view.
3. <kbd>F2</kbd>

Nothing happens. Scroll back to the token, the rename widget is there but without focus, which is owned by the editor itself. Maybe the line should be revealed on <kbd>F2</kbd>?

data.title: VS Code - Info: Resolve Dependancies Fails if User Path contains a SPACE
data.body:
Hi,

The command executed by VS Code to install and resolve missing dependancies for an ASP.NET application fails with "Can't find path" when the path to the users' home folder includes a space. For example:
c:\users\joeblogs\ <- works
c:\users\joe blogs\ <- fails

Running procmon I see it's attempting to execute:
cmd.exe /c start /wait cmd.exe /c "C:\Users\joe blogs.dnx\runtimes\dnx-clr-win-x86.1.0.0-rc1-update1\bin\dnu.cmd restore & pause"

Which fails.

Thanks

data.title: Treat surrogate pairs as one character
data.body:
I felt bad touching the other test cases but it was the most minimal change to the suite I could come up with. This doesn't address some other, related issues like "8 selected" in the status bar when there are actually only 7 "real" characters in the selection.

Fixes https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2069

data.title: bug in JS highlighting multiline string
Backspace deletes incomplete surrogate pair
data.body:
Reproduce:
1. Enter `xyz💩abc` in a line ("abc" for better visibility of follow-up bug)
2. Place cursor between 💩 and `a`
3. Hit backspace
4. 💩 and everything after it (!) vanishes
5. Hit backspace again
6. "abc" is back (because it deleted the invalid character / the first half of the surrogate pair)

data.title: Is there any event called when a you Open Projects/Folders in Code?
data.body:
There are some events that are called you open/close a file (`onDidOpenTextDocument` and `onDidCloseTextDocument`), but it appears that aren't similar for **Projects/Folders**.

I would like to detect when a Project/Folder is opened in **Code**. Via command line, like `code C:\Temp\Myfolder` or using the menu `File / Open Folder...`. Don't get confused about _opening sub-folders in the tree, this is not the case_ :smile: 

At first, it doesn't matter if a new **Code** instance is created, or if it only changes the current Folder/Project, And it should be called also when you use `Open Recent`.

Thanks in advance

data.title: whole line selection on word-wrapped documents
data.body:
If word-wrapping is enabled (`"editor.wrappingColumn": 0` in my case) the whole line selection gets broken. Both clicking the line number or triple clicking selects the line until the artificial break, not the actual.

![](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/105338698/ShareX/2016-01/2016-01-17_11-28-30.gif)

data.title: What's happened with c-sharp language service?
data.body:
My [extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items/reflectiondm.ClassyNaming) had a dependency to 'vscode.scharp' language as it is described [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/master/docs/extensionAPI/extension-points.md#contributeslanguages). The reason this dependency was introduced was that it was impossible to contribute my own completion suffusions to C# completion list back then. Recently (probably with vscode 0.10.6 update) it suddenly stopped working. A quick investigation shown that the reason is the extension cannot reference 'vscode.csharp' anymore in its extensionDependencies list. I've removed it and extension start working as usual, and still can add its suggestions to c# completion list.
Were there any changes related to csharp language and its interaction with extensions? Everything is working now, but I would really like to know what happened.
